name: Filipino Mental Health Initiative of San Francisco
description: Through capacity building, outreach and engagement in the Filipino community, the Filipino Mental Health Initiative (FMHI-SF) strives to reduce stigma, promote awareness, and increase access to culturally appropriate wellness services and the effectiveness of the behavioral health services in San Francisco. Also offering scholarships to community members interested in Youth Mental Health First Aid, Adult Mental Health First Aid, and Mental Health First Aid Instructor covering fees of the courses
fullDescription: Through capacity building, outreach and engagement in the Filipino community, the Filipino Mental Health Initiative (FMHI-SF) strives to reduce stigma, promote awareness, and increase access to culturally appropriate wellness services and the effectiveness of the behavioral health services in San Francisco. Also offering scholarships to community members interested in Youth Mental Health First Aid, Adult Mental Health First Aid, and Mental Health First Aid Instructor covering fees of the courses
whatTheyOffer: Through capacity building, outreach and engagement in the Filipino community, the Filipino Mental Health Initiative (FMHI-SF) strives to reduce stigma, promote awareness, and increase access to culturally appropriate wellness services and the effectiveness of the behavioral health services in San Francisco. Also offering scholarships to community members interested in Youth Mental Health First Aid, Adult Mental Health First Aid, and Mental Health First Aid Instructor covering fees of the courses
howToGetIt: Applicants working or living in San Francisco's South of Market neighborhood will be prioritized. BIPOC youth workers, organizational leaders, caregivers, and parents are strongly encouraged to apply. Contact Verma Zapanta at verma@bayanihancc.org for questions.
